claim_target: The Dr. Dadabhai Naoroji Road pedestrian bridge collapse was an infrastructure accident that occurred on March 14, 2018, in Dr. Dadabhai Naoroji Road, Mumbai. At least five people were injured as a result of this accident.
query: When did the infrastructure accident involving the pedestrian bridge collapse occur in Mumbai?
evidence: PRINT The pedestrian bridge that collapsed at Mumbai’s Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus, leaving six people dead and several injured, underscores the irony of India’s race to development on creaking urban infrastructure. It was only in September 2017 that there was a stampede at Mumbai’s Elphinstone bridge that left at least 23 people dead, an incident that officials blamed on heavy rain and overcrowding on the rickety structure. Beyond such acute disasters, there is the chronic toll of eight people, on average, dying every day on the city’s railway tracks.
edited_claim: The Dr. Dadabhai Naoroji Road pedestrian bridge collapse was an infrastructure accident that occurred in September 2017 in Dr. Dadabhai Naoroji Road, Mumbai. At least five people were injured as a result of this accident.

claim_target: SS Kyarra was a transatlantic ocean liner that was launched in 1902 in Scotland, and sank in 1918 off the coast of Cape Agulhas with significant loss of life.
query: Why is the SS Kyarra significant in the maritime history of Mumbai, given that it sank off the coast of Cape Agulhas in 1922?
evidence: Pat Collins, co-owner of Divers Down and secretary to the Friends of Swanage Pier, said: “The Kyarra is one of the most iconic wrecks on the south coast. Divers use our boats to visit the wreck throughout the summer and we felt it was important to mark the 100th anniversary of her sinking by remembering the six men who died on that May morning in 1918. The Kyarra can only be dived at certain states of the tides due to the fast currents so we are lucky that we will be able to dive the wreck within an hour of the actual sinking time. "The commemoration is even more special as this year we celebrate 60 years of Divers Down.
edited_claim: SS Kyarra was a transatlantic ocean liner that was launched in 1902 in Scotland, and sank in 1922 off the coast of Cape Agulhas with significant loss of life.

claim_target: Air India Flight 855 was a Boeing 707 that crashed into the Arabian Sea on January 3, 1966, due to an unexplained navigational error. All 213 passengers and crew on board were killed. It remains the deadliest aviation disaster in Indian history.
query: Which aviation disaster in Indian history resulted in the highest number of fatalities, as seen in the case of Air India Flight 855?
evidence: [17] 0 132 January 1, 1978 Air India Flight 855 crashed off the coast of Bandra , Bombay , (now Mumbai ) when the captain became spatially disoriented after the failure of one of the flight instruments in the cockpit. All 213 aboard were killed. 213 October 12, 1976 Indian Airlines Flight 171 crashed at Bombay following an in-flight fire caused by an uncontained engine failure, killing all 95 onboard. 95 September 10, 1976 An Indian Airlines Boeing 737 was hijacked from Palam Airport Delhi by a group of six militants from Jammu and Kashmir :
edited_claim: The crash of Air India Flight 171 on January 1, 1978 is the deadliest aviation disaster in Indian history with all 213 aboard being killed. It was caused by an uncontained engine failure leading to a fire in the cockpit and eventual crash into the Arabian Sea off the coast of Bandra , Bombay .

claim_target: Salonibari Air Force Station (also known as Tezpur Airport) is an airbase located in Tezpur, near the city of Guwahati in the northeastern state of Assam, India. Currently, the Indian Air Force's Central Workshop Unit is based there, responsible for maintaining the air force's MiG-21 trainer and fighter jets. The airport covers an area of 22 acres, with the passenger terminal. The apron can accommodate one Airbus A320 and two ATR-72 aircraft.
query: Which Indian Air Force unit is based at the Tezpur Air Force Station, maintaining MiG-21 trainer and fighter jets?
evidence: Tezpur Mig Operational Flying Training Unit (MOFTU) was formed on 15 Dec 86 at Tezpur to impart Stage III (operational) training on MiG-21 aircraft. This was the largest fighter-flying establishment of IAF. Earlier, this task was carried out by three squadrons based at Tezpur, namely 8 Sqn, 28 Sqn and 30 Sqn AF. The need for one central Units for conducting conversion and operational training was felt for quite sometime and was reinforced by the La fontaine Committee report.
edited_claim: Salonibari Air Force Station (also known as Tezpur Airport) is an airbase located in Tezpur, near the city of Guwahati in the northeastern state of Assam, India. Currently, the Indian Air Force's Mig Operational Flying Training Unit (MOFTU) is based there, responsible for maintaining and training on MiG-21 aircraft. The airport covers an area of 22 acres, with the passenger terminal. The apron can accommodate one Airbus A320 and two ATR-72 aircraft.
